subject: RE: [junit] setUp versus constructors
msgSnippet: The fact that setup() and the constructor are equivalent as Cedric pointed out is always confusing and something everyone should be aware of using JUnit.

The fact that setup() and the constructor are equivalent as Cedric pointed =
out is always confusing and something everyone should be aware of using JUn=
it.

 

Andreas

From: junit@yahoogrou=

t: Tuesday, July 18, 2006 6:52 AM

Subject: Re: [j=

On 7/17/06, Brett L. Schuchert <schuche=
rt@... <mailto:schuchert%40yahoo.com> > wrote:
>
> Test Isolation
> a=

> The constructor is run once, setUp (or @Before) is run before each test
=
> method. If you want to make sure each test has the same setup/configurati=
on
> before the test executes, put it in setUp. If, on the other hand, you =
want
> to make sure all tests in a test case use the same values, put it in=
 the
> constructor.

Not exactly: since JUnit creates a brand new instance =
of your test class
before every test method, putting code in your construct=
or is exactly
equivalent to putting it in setUp().

-- 
C=F0gic
http://test=
ng.org <http://testng.org>
